title: Partitioning Techniques for Reducing Computational Effort of Routing in Large Networks.
abstract: NoA new scheme is presented for partitioning a network having a specific number of nodes and degree of connectivity such that the number of operations required to find a constrained path between a source node and destination node, averaged over all source-destination pairs, is minimised. The scheme can speed up the routing function, possibly by orders of magnitude under favourable conditions, at the cost of a sub-optimal solution

A new scheme is presented for partitioning a network having a specific number of nodes and degree of connectivity such that the number of operations required to find a constrained path between a source node and destination node, averaged over all source-destination pairs, is minimised. The scheme can speed up the routing function, possibly by orders of magnitude under favourable conditions, at the cost of a sub-optimal solution.</dc:description><dc:date>
